newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - July 30.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - July 30.

text.p: -- Yahoo! Inc said its board approved a three-for-two stock split. The company also formed a global electronic commerce alliance with Visa International and restated second quarter results -- to a loss of $0.74 per share from a profit of $0.02 -- to reflect a related one-time charge of $21.2 million. The stock last traded at 48-4/16.

-- The European Commission formally cleared the merger of Boeing Co and McDonnell Douglas Corp, ending a five-month investigation into the deal. Boeing closed at 58-5/16 while McDonnell Douglas closed at 75-11/16.

-- Laidlaw announced a definitive agreement to acquire EmCare Holdings for US$38 cash per share. The deal was valued at $400 million, including the assumption of debt. Laidlaw closed in Toronto at 21.30 and EmCare closed on Nasdaq at 38-4/16.

-- SCI Systems Inc reported fourth quarter earnings of $0.94 per diluted share versus $0.77 in the year-ago quarter. It also announced a two-for-one stock split. The stock closed at 79-5/16, then rose as high as 80 in after-hours trading.
